Class MissionControlGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • pc.MissionControlGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, CommListener

    public class MissionControlGUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements CommListener
    GUI to draw robot path and current location of the robot. Uses mouse to enter x,y coordinates and transmits commands from the GUI to the robot.
    Author:
    Corey Short, Phuoc Nguyen, Khoa Tran. Reference to Glassey OffScreenGrid.java and Milestone 5 sample GUI.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MissionControlGUI

        public MissionControlGUI()
        Creates the multiple frames, components, and layouts needed for the Mission Control GUI. If a JButton or the map drawn in OffScreenDrawing is clicked by the user, the appropriate ActionListeners are implemented and communication to the NXT robot is sent with the respective data and message enum type. (enums are stored in MessageType.java) Data is passed to GridControlCommunicator.java to interact with the robot.
